description: Tracks all Claude Code activities in real-time and logs them for monitoring and debugging
author: JSONbored
useCases: Monitor Claude Code tool usage in real-time
Create activity reports for team review

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/bin/bash

# Read the tool input from stdin
INPUT=$(cat)
TOOL_NAME=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_name')
FILE_PATH=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // .tool_input.path // ""')
TOOL_ACTION=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_action // "unknown"')

echo "ðŸ“Š Real-time Activity Tracker - Logging activity..."

# Create .claude directory if it doesn't exist
mkdir -p .claude

# Create daily activity log
ACTIVITY_LOG=".claude/activity-$(date +%Y%m%d).log"
ACTIVITY_JSON=".claude/activity-$(date +%Y%m%d).json"

# Current timestamp
TIMESTAMP=$(date --iso-8601=seconds 2>/dev/null || date -Iseconds 2>/dev/null || date)

# Log in human-readable format
echo "[$TIMESTAMP] Tool: $TOOL_NAME | File: $FILE_PATH | Action: $TOOL_ACTION" >> "$ACTIVITY_LOG"

# Log in JSON format for programmatic analysis
cat >> "$ACTIVITY_JSON" << EOF
{
  "timestamp": "$TIMESTAMP",
  "tool_name": "$TOOL_NAME",
  "file_path": "$FILE_PATH",
  "action": "$TOOL_ACTION",
  "session_id": "$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)_$$"
},
EOF

# Keep only last 100 entries in activity log to prevent it from growing too large
if [ -f "$ACTIVITY_LOG" ]; then
    tail -n 100 "$ACTIVITY_LOG" > "$ACTIVITY_LOG.tmp" && mv "$ACTIVITY_LOG.tmp" "$ACTIVITY_LOG"
fi

# Keep only last 100 entries in JSON log
if [ -f "$ACTIVITY_JSON" ]; then
    tail -n 100 "$ACTIVITY_JSON" > "$ACTIVITY_JSON.tmp" && mv "$ACTIVITY_JSON.tmp" "$ACTIVITY_JSON"
fi

# Activity statistics
if [ -f "$ACTIVITY_LOG" ]; then
    TOTAL_ACTIVITIES=$(wc -l < "$ACTIVITY_LOG")
    echo "ðŸ“ˆ Session Activity Count: $TOTAL_ACTIVITIES"
    
    # Show recent activity summary
    echo "ðŸ•’ Recent Activities:"
    tail -n 3 "$ACTIVITY_LOG" | while read -r line; do
        echo "  â€¢ $line"
    done
    
    # File operation summary
    WRITE_COUNT=$(grep -c "Write\|Edit" "$ACTIVITY_LOG" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
    read_COUNT=$(grep -c "Read" "$ACTIVITY_LOG" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
    
    echo "ðŸ“Š Today's Summary:"
    echo "  â€¢ Write/Edit operations: $WRITE_COUNT"
    echo "  â€¢ Read operations: $READ_COUNT"
fi

# Weekly activity archive (every Sunday)
if [ "$(date +%u)" = "7" ]; then
    ARCHIVE_DIR=".claude/archive/$(date +%Y-%m)"
    mkdir -p "$ARCHIVE_DIR"
    
    # Move old logs to archive
    find .claude -name "activity-*.log" -mtime +7 -exec mv {} "$ARCHIVE_DIR/" \;
    find .claude -name "activity-*.json" -mtime +7 -exec mv {} "$ARCHIVE_DIR/" \;
    
    echo "ðŸ“¦ Weekly archive created in $ARCHIVE_DIR"
fi

echo "âœ… Activity logged to $ACTIVITY_LOG"

exit 0

faqTroubleshooting.issue: Activity logs show incorrect timestamps or 'unknown' dates
faqTroubleshooting.solution: ISO-8601 date varies by platform. Replace 'date --iso-8601=seconds' with portable: 'date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ"'. Works on both Linux and macOS without fallback.

faqTroubleshooting.issue: JSON activity log is malformed with trailing commas
faqTroubleshooting.solution: Each append adds trailing comma creating invalid JSON. Wrap in array: initialize with '[', append without trailing comma, close ']' on end. Or rebuild: 'jq -s . file.json'.

faqTroubleshooting.issue: Log rotation (100 entries) doesn't preserve most recent activities
faqTroubleshooting.solution: tail keeps oldest 100 lines. Fix: 'tail -n 100' keeps last 100. To keep newest: 'tac | head -n 100 | tac'. Or rebuild retention logic with proper time-based sorting.

faqTroubleshooting.issue: Weekly archive triggers fail on macOS (date +%u returns wrong day)
faqTroubleshooting.solution: macOS date lacks %u for weekday. Replace with: 'if [ "$(date +%w)" = "0" ]; then' (Sunday=0). Or use portable: '[ $(date +%A) = "Sunday" ]' for name-based check.

faqTroubleshooting.issue: Session IDs duplicate when multiple Claude instances run simultaneously
faqTroubleshooting.solution: Current session_id uses timestamp+PID but PID can conflict. Add random suffix: "$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)_$$_$RANDOM" or use UUID: "$(uuidgen 2>/dev/null || echo $RANDOM$RANDOM)".

faqTroubleshooting.issue: File operation summary shows zero counts despite activity
faqTroubleshooting.solution: grep case-sensitive search misses variations. Use case-insensitive: 'grep -ic "write\|edit" "$ACTIVITY_LOG"' or normalize tool names on write to lowercase for consistent matching.

faqTroubleshooting.issue: Archive directory grows unbounded consuming disk space
faqTroubleshooting.solution: No cleanup for monthly archives. Add retention: 'find .claude/archive -type d -mtime +180 -exec rm -rf {} \;' removing archives older than 6 months from archive creation.

faqTroubleshooting.issue: Activity log missing entries for certain tool invocations
faqTroubleshooting.solution: stdin parse fails if jq missing or INPUT empty. Add validation: 'if [ -z "$INPUT" ] || ! command -v jq; then exit 0; fi' before parsing. Install jq as dependency.

faqTroubleshooting.issue: Log files locked causing permission denied errors on write
faqTroubleshooting.solution: Concurrent writes from parallel Claude sessions. Use flock: '(flock -x 200; echo ".." >> log; ) 200>/var/lock/activity.lock' for atomic append operations.
